measured_by: Brief Comprehensive Effects of Alcohol Questionnaire (B-CEOA)
justification: “The Brief Comprehensive Effects of Alcohol Questionnaire (B-CEOA; Ham et al., 2005) is a fifteen-item measure of alcohol outcome expectancies and valuations.”

measured_by: Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test – Consumption (AUDIT-C)
justification: “The Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test-Consumption (AUDIT-C; Bush et al., 1998) measured participants' personal alcohol consumption… The scale demonstrated acceptable reliability (Cronbach's = .72).”

measured_by: Seven-item credibility scale adapted from Berman & Cutler (1996)
justification: “A seven-item measure adapted from Berman & Cutler (1996) assessed the perceived credibility of the victim/witness at trial.”

measured_by: Single 7-point Likert scale (1 = not at all, 7 = very)
justification: “A single 7-point Likert scale assessed the perceived cognitive impairment of the victim/witness during the crime (1 = not at all, 7 = very).”
“Participants delivered a dichotomous verdict and rated the probability that the defendant committed the crime on a 7-point Likert scale (1 = not likely at all, 7 = very likely).”
